item.title: Not so easy
item.author: simbatango@gmail.com (Simba)
item.description:
by  Simba tango

A teacher and his former student, on his first trip to Buenos Aires, run into each other outside La Glorieta and starts to chat. Suddenly the student bursts out:

**A:** (about the music) This is milonga, right? **S: **No, this is tango.

The conversation is drawing to an end, as the teacher is heading home. They talk for another minute, until the next song of the tanda starts and the student is eager to dance more:

**A: **Well, I think I have to go and dance a little milonga.... **S: **(!)

The teacher watches him walk back to the pavillion, turns around, picks up his young son, and dances into the darkness as Fiorentino sings the last words of Toda mi vída…
